entry.title: Celtic’s CL opponents - past games
entry.summary:
Photo by Craig Foy/SNS Group via Getty Images
If you were under a rock yesterday, or asleep listening to the latest GIGPOD, you’ll no doubt have seen our draw for the Champions League.
⭐ We have been drawn in Group F of the @ChampionsLeague - Fixtures TBC #CelticFC | #UCLdraw pic.twitter.com/IfDpVHtog2— Celtic Football Club (@CelticFC) August 25, 2022
The manager gave his thoughts on the group earlier
Ange Postecoglou gives his thoughts on our Champions League Group F opposition Real Madrid RB Leipzig Shakhtar DonetskEuropean Nights are back at Paradise!⭐️#UCL | @ChampionsLeague | #COYBIG pic.twitter.com/zWl9JivrEs— Celtic Football Club (@CelticFC) August 26, 2022
It’s nowhere near as bad as it could have been and there’s some winnable games in there! We’ve beaten all of the teams we’ve been drawn with before in the past too. Starting with Real Madrid in 1980, although they won the return leg 3-0.
Back in 2018, KT and Eddy scored to help us to a 2-1 win over RB Leipzig
And we’ve played Shakhtar twice, in 2004 and 2007, with the latter being the most memorable fixture! A great video of Donati’s ‘wondergoal’ below!
Next up - Dundee United on Sunday for Ange and the team, we’ll cover that over the weekend!

Photo by Steve Welsh/PA Images via Getty Images
As promised the latest GIGPOD is now out and live everywhere. You can get it on iTunes, Spotify or anywhere else you listen to your podcasts!
NEW PODCAST ⚪️ GIGPOD EP 125: CELTIC CHEERS, HEARTS TEARS Reidzo & Stevie discuss: John’s PROTEST, JJ back to his best, Neilson’s whining and a MOCK champions league draw Spotify: https://t.co/nSPxAo4jFg& everywhere else! pic.twitter.com/zzGPxLDN4p— GIGPOD ⚪️ (@gigpod) August 23, 2022
Check it out for Reidzo’s very exciting Saturday tale about going to Braehead, spending nothing, meeting a fan and then catching the last ten minutes of the game at Easter Road. It really is riveting stuff. Elsewhere, we said goodbye, officially this time, to Chris Jullien.
